creator: mark.abbott@openwave.com
text:
This bug effects JSP documents written in the XML
syntax only. What I see is that the following JSP fragment:

   <tagA><tagB>text</tagB><tagA>

appears just like that in the output, without wrapping the
text in a <jsp:text> tag.

However, this JSP fragment:

  <tagA><tagB></tagB>text<tagB></tagB></tagA>

appears in the output as

  <tagA><tagB></tagB><tagB></tagB></tagA>text

unless the text is wrapped in a <jsp:text>, in which case it
appears as written in the JSP. 

The latter behavior would seem to be a bug, as either it
should be a parse error for the <jsp:text> to be omitted or
the output should match the input.  In the first case, it
may also be a parse error for the <jsp:text> to be omitted,
unless this is considered part of an XML fragment by the spec.
